meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of pollen.
meanings.sent1: The pollinic flowers released a yellow dust when touched.
meanings.sent2: The bee carried the pollinic powder from one flower to another.
meanings.sent3: The pollinic plants had a party and threw pollen confetti everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The air was filled with a pollinic haze, making everything yellow.
meanings.sent5: The pollinic scent of the flowers was strong and sweet.

meanings.sent1: The pollinic anthers burst open, releasing tiny grains.
meanings.sent2: The pollinic plants attracted bees with their sweet nectar.
meanings.sent3: The pollinic trees were always sneezing because of their pollen.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a pollinic paradise, buzzing with activity.
meanings.sent5: The pollinic pods burst open, spreading pollen in the wind.
